property.name: text
property.value: Set the "predictions" parameter a value between 1 to "number of predictions you want to make". Set the "input_seq_size" parameter the size of the input sequence. "timesteps" parameter is the result of the input sequence size, multiplied by the number of predictions.

property.name: text
property.value: timestep_0: The first timestep of the GRU network. Here, the previous hidden state ht-1 is initialized with zeros. rest_timesteps: The next timesteps of the GRU network. Here, in each timestep, we take another input sequence and also the hidden state of the previous timestep. dense: The Dense layer in order to take the prediction results. reset: The final state, where the model finishes execution.

property.name: text
property.value: Parameters: skip: the number of lines to skip from the input file. skip2: the number of lines to skip for timestep_0 input. i: determines when to display a prediction. c: counts the number of predictions each time.

property.name: text
property.value: GRU_0: This is a GRU network implementation of the first timestep, where ht-1 is zero.

property.name: text
property.value:
Set the input dimensions by double clicking the blue bullets.
w, u = weight matrices

property.name: text
property.value: GRU: This is a GRU implementation for the rest timesteps. From now on, the GRU network has two inputs, the input of the current timestep and the hidden state from the previous timestep.

property.name: text
property.value: -Dense Layer- It gives the predicted value.

property.name: text
property.value: 1) Open "DenseData" actor an choose the .csv files (weights and biases) 2) Double-click on "FC" actor and set the dimensions of your input data.

property.name: text
property.value:
For normalization, we subtracted mean and divide by standard deviation, which is: y = (input - mean)/std
Now, in order to de-normalize, we do: input = y*std + mean

entity.name: DiscreteClock
entity.doc: Create periodic timed events.
